info.title: OLS Service
info.description: REST API for OLS. Please see this page for defined response field in OLS.

tags.name: Individual Controller
tags.description: NOTE: For IRI parameters, the value must be URL encoded. For example, the IRI http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_0000124 should be encoded as http%3A%252F%2Fpurl.obolibrary.org%2Fobo%2FIAO_0000124.

tags.name: V2 Stats Controller
tags.description: This endpoint provides statistics about the current state of the ontology index. It includes the number of ontologies, classes, individuals and properties indexed, and the last time the index was modified.

tags.name: V2 Individual Controller
tags.description: This endpoint provides access to individuals information.

tags.name: Property Controller
tags.description: NOTE: For IRI parameters, the value must be URL encoded. For example, the IRI http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/DUO_0000041 should be encoded as http%3A%2F%2Fpurl.obolibrary.org%2Fobo%2FDUO_0000041.

tags.name: V2 Property Controller
tags.description: This endpoint provides access to property information.

tags.name: Ontology Individual Controller
tags.description: NOTE: For IRI parameters, the value must be URL encoded. For example, the IRI http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_0000103 should be encoded as http%3A%2F%2Fpurl.obolibrary.org%2Fobo%2FIAO_0000103.

tags.name: Ontology Property Controller
tags.description: NOTE: For IRI parameters, the value must be URL encoded. For example, the IRI http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/DUO_0000041 should be encoded as http%3A%2F%2Fpurl.obolibrary.org%2Fobo%2FDUO_0000041.

tags.name: V2 Ontology Controller
tags.description: This endpoint provides access to ontology information.

tags.name: Terms Controller
tags.description: NOTE: For IRI parameters, the value must be URL encoded. For example, the IRI http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/DUO_0000017 should be encoded as http%3A%2F%2Fpurl.obolibrary.org%2Fobo%2FDUO_0000017.

tags.name: V2 Entity Controller
tags.description: This endpoint provides access to entity information.

tags.name: Ontology Term Controller
tags.description: NOTE: For IRI parameters, the value must be URL encoded. For example, the IRI http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/DUO_0000017 should be encoded as http%3A%2F%2Fpurl.obolibrary.org%2Fobo%2FDUO_0000017.

tags.name: V2 Class Controller

parameters.name: pageable
parameters.description: Specify the size of the result you want to get in the output

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: This parameter specify the search query text.

parameters.name: searchFields
parameters.description: This parameter is a white space separated list of fields to search in. The fields are weighted equally. The fields are defined in the schema. The default fields are label and definition. The fields weights can be boosted by appending a caret ^ and a positive integer to the field name. For example, label^3 synonyms^2 description^1 logical_definition^1

parameters.name: boostFields
parameters.description: This parameter is a white space separated list of fields appended with a caret to boost in search. The default fields are type, is_defining_ontology, label, curie, shortForm and synonym . The fields weights can be boosted by appending a caret ^ and a positive integer to the field name.

parameters.name: exactMatch
parameters.description: As the name suggests its a boolean parameter to specify if search should be exact match or not.The default value is false

parameters.name: includeObsoleteEntities
parameters.description: A boolean parameter to specify if obsolete entities should be included or not. Default value is false.

parameters.name: searchProperties
parameters.description: Specify any other search field here which are not specified by searchFields or boostFields.

parameters.name: pageable
parameters.description: Specify the size of the result you want to get in the output

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: This parameter specify the search query text.

parameters.name: searchFields
parameters.description: This parameter is a white space separated list of fields to search in. The fields are weighted equally. The fields are defined in the schema. The default fields are label, ontologyId and definition. The fields weights can be boosted by appending a caret ^ and a positive integer to the field name. For example, label^3 synonyms^2 description^1 logical_definition^1

parameters.name: boostFields
parameters.description: This parameter is a white space separated list of fields appended with a caret to boost in search. The default fields are type, is_defining_ontology, label, curie, shortForm and synonym . The fields weights can be boosted by appending a caret ^ and a positive integer to the field name.

parameters.name: includeObsoleteEntities

parameters.name: searchProperties
parameters.description: Specify any other search field here which are not specified by searchFields or boostFields.

parameters.description: Ontology Id to get the information about.

parameters.name: exactMatch
parameters.description: As the name suggests its a boolean parameter to specify if search should be exact match or not.The default value is false

parameters.name: includeObsoleteEntities
parameters.description: A boolean parameter to specify if obsolete entities should be included or not. Default value is false.

parameters.name: searchProperties
parameters.description: Specify any other search field here which are not specified by searchFields or boostFields.

parameters.name: iri
parameters.description: The IRI of the term.

parameters.name: short_form
parameters.description: This refers to the short form of the term.

parameters.name: obo_id
parameters.description: This refers to the OBO ID of the term.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This can be any of the above i.e. iri, short_form or obo_id.

parameters.name: iri
parameters.description: The IRI of the term, this value must be double URL encoded

parameters.name: iri
parameters.description: The IRI of the term

parameters.name: short_form
parameters.description: This refers to the short form of the term.

parameters.name: obo_id
parameters.description: This refers to the OBO ID of the term.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This can be any of the above i.e. iri, short_form or obo_id.

parameters.name: iri
parameters.description: The IRI of the term, this value must be double URL encoded

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The terms to search. By default the search is performed over term labels, synonyms, descriptions, identifiers and annotation properties.

parameters.name: ontology
parameters.description: Restrict a search to a set of ontologies e.g. ontology=efo,bfo

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Restrict a search to an entity type, one of {class,property,individual,ontology}

parameters.name: slim
parameters.description: Restrict a search to an particular set of slims by name

parameters.name: fieldList
parameters.description: Specifcy the fields to return, the defaults are {iri,label,short_form,obo_id,ontology_name,ontology_prefix,description,type}

parameters.name: obsoletes
parameters.description: Set to true to include obsoleted terms in the results

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Set to true to only return terms that are in a defining ontology e.g. Only return matches to gene ontology terms in the gene ontology, and exclude ontologies where those terms are also referenced

parameters.name: childrenOf
parameters.description: You can restrict a search to children of a given term. Supply a list of IRI for the terms that you want to search under

parameters.name: allChildrenOf
parameters.description: You can restrict a search to all children of a given term. Supply a list of IRI for the terms that you want to search under (subclassOf/is-a plus any hierarchical/transitive properties like 'part of' or 'develops from')

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The terms to search. By default the search is performed over term labels, synonyms, descriptions, identifiers and annotation properties.

parameters.name: ontology
parameters.description: Restrict a search to a set of ontologies e.g. ontology=efo,bfo

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Restrict a search to an entity type, one of {class,property,individual,ontology}

parameters.name: slim
parameters.description: Restrict a search to an particular set of slims by name

parameters.name: fieldList
parameters.description: Specifcy the fields to return, the defaults are {iri,label,short_form,obo_id,ontology_name,ontology_prefix,description,type}

parameters.name: queryFields
parameters.description: Specify the fields to query, the defaults are {label, synonym, description, short_form, obo_id, annotations, logical_description, iri}

parameters.name: exact
parameters.description: Set to true for exact matches

parameters.name: groupField
parameters.description: Group results by unique id (IRI)

parameters.name: obsoletes
parameters.description: Set to true to include obsoleted terms in the results

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Set to true to only return terms that are in a defining ontology e.g. Only return matches to gene ontology terms in the gene ontology, and exclude ontologies where those terms are also referenced

parameters.name: childrenOf
parameters.description: You can restrict a search to children of a given term. Supply a list of IRI for the terms that you want to search under

parameters.name: allChildrenOf
parameters.description: You can restrict a search to all children of a given term. Supply a list of IRI for the terms that you want to search under (subclassOf/is-a plus any hierarchical/transitive properties like 'part of' or 'develops from')

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: You can select the format you want the response in. Default is `json` but you can select xml, csv etc. Full list of acceptable value can be found here: https://solr.apache.org/guide/solr/latest/query-guide/response-writers.html

parameters.name: obo_id

parameters.description: The IRI of the property, this value must be double URL encoded

parameters.description: The IRI of the property, this IRI should exist in the specified ontology by {onto} param. This value must be double URL encoded

parameters.name: onto
parameters.description: The ID of the ontology. For example for Data Use Ontology, the ID is duo.

parameters.name: includeObsoletes
parameters.description: A boolean flag to get Obsolete terms

parameters.name: onto
parameters.description: The ID of the ontology. For example for Data Use Ontology, the ID is duo.

parameters.name: iri
parameters.description: The IRI of the term.

parameters.name: short_form
parameters.description: This refers to the short form of the term.

parameters.name: obo_id
parameters.description: This refers to the OBO ID of the term.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This can be any of the above i.e. iri, short_form or obo_id.

parameters.description: The ID of the ontology. For example for Information Artifact Ontology, the ID is iao.
